products.description: This is only a fake code scan - used by integration tests. The code scan will just return data from uploaded zip file

mandatory.description: when 'true' quality scan results are added as well
numeric, 1-gets all, 2-only critical,fatal and medium, 3- only critical and fatal

optional.description: add tip of the day as info
a parameter from configuration - will be different in each integration test config from sechub integration test server
mapping1 for testing - only in variant j, will have mapping from sechub
mapping 2 for testing - only in variant j, will have fallback data (empty)

products.description: This is only a fake code scan - used by integration tests. The code scan will just return data from uploaded zip file

mandatory.description: when 'true' quality scan results are added as well
numeric, 1-gets all, 2-only critical,fatal and medium, 3- only critical and fatal

optional.description: add tip of the day as info
a parameter from configuration - will be different in each integration test config from sechub integration test server
Supported data types. Should not be changed at runtime

products.description: This is only a fake web scan - used by integration tests.

mandatory.description: numeric, 1-gets all, 2-only critical,fatal and medium, 3- only critical and fatal
We accept only sources (open api files) or none (simple webscan) here!

optional.description: a parameter from configuration - will be different in each integration test config from sechub integration test server
normally this parameter is NOT sent to script, but for testing we add this parameter, so we can check by TestAPI...

products.description: This is only a fake infra scan - used by integration tests.

mandatory.description: We do not need any sources or binaries here

products.description: This webscan will return SARIF json test file data based on the parameter 'pds.test.key.variantname'

optional.description: when 'true' quality scan results are added as well
numeric, 1-gets all, 2-only critical,fatal and medium, 3- only critical and fatal
add tip of the day as info
a parameter from configuration - currently we provide :'owasp-file-1'
We accept only sources (open api files) or none (simple webscan) here!

products.description: Runs Checkmarx. This config should be (except the script path and the id) always same as pds-solution variant!

mandatory.description: The base URL of the checkmarx server.
The user (or an environment entry) of the checkmarx user.
The password (or an environment entry) of the checkmarx user.

optional.description: The name of the engine to use. If not set, a default engine will be used.
When not set, the default preset will be used
When true, a mocked adapter will be used.
The period time in milliseconds when checkmarx adapter tries to fetch the result from checkmarx server again.
The timout in minutes when checkmarx adapter will stop communictaion with checkmarx server and return an error instead.
This is a standard value and has not to be set. It is NOT a really secret value. But we made this value optional to be safe in future, if the static default value must be changed.
When true, full scan is always active.
Maximum amount of possible retries for situations when a 400 bad request happened on Checkmarx server.
Time to wait until retry is done when a 400 bad request happened on Checkmarx server.
Maximum amount of possible retries for situations when a 500 server internal error happened on Checkmarx server.
Time to wait until retry is done when a 500 server internal error happened on Checkmarx server.

Maximum amount of possible retries for situations when a network error happened on communication to Checkmarx server (means not vailable/ no connection possible). This is interesting for updating Checkmarx servers without stopping PDS jobs, so setup this amount together with the wait for retries in a way, that the update time is inside the given time period!
Time to wait until retry is done when a network server happened on communication to Checkmarx server. Please look at description of pds.checkmarx.resilience.networkerror.max.retries for more details.
